title: Tilapia Po’ Boys
summary: Tilapia Po’ Boys is a dairy free and pescatarian recipe with 30 servings. One serving contains 68 calories, 4g of protein, and 3g of fat. For 41 cents per serving, this recipe covers 3% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 12 people have made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up lettuce, mayonnaise, hot sauce and potato chips, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 8 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 28%, this dish is rather bad. Try Healthy Grilled Tilapia Po' Boys, Grilled Tilapia Po' Boys with Homemade Tartar Sauce, and Tilapian in Mushroom Sauce (Tilapian en Salsa de Champiñones) for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tilapian on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 46 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Bright yellow/gold color, quite luminous. Superb smoky toasty nose, typical for this grape on limestone in Alsace (no new oak in our wines, just very long total lees contact). Some light reductive aromas that actually fit the style of dry Pinot-Gris. The palate is rich and creamy, with a velvety texture yet fully dry. It is an easy wine to drink now as there is no unnecessary weight. The finish is nice and round but fully dry. The complex limestone blend brings great acid balance and a certain weight. It should develop very nicely over the next few years.

instructions: Directions            In a shallow bowl, combine the flour and seafood seasoning. Coat the tilapia with the flour mixture (tapping off any excess). Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook the tilapia in batches until cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes per side, adding more oil to the pan if necessary.Dividing evenly, spread the mayonnaise on the baguette. Form sandwiches with the baguette, lettuce, pickle chips, and tilapia. Serve with the hot sauce and potato chips.

steps.step: In a shallow bowl, combine the flour and seafood seasoning. Coat the tilapia with the flour mixture (tapping off any excess).

Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook the tilapia in batches until cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes per side, adding more oil to the pan if necessary.Dividing evenly, spread the mayonnaise on the baguette. Form sandwiches with the baguette, lettuce, pickle chips, and tilapia.
Serve with the hot sauce and potato chips.
